//: Appears in the refugee center as a bulk trader.  Promotes production of nonperishable food.

dynamic_line: What can I help you with?

responses.text: I'm here to deliver some food supplies.
Are you able to buy some canning supplies?
I was told you had work for me?
What's the deal with this written-on paper money you guys use?
That's all for now.  Can we discuss something else?
That's all for now.  I'd best get going.

dynamic_line: Yes, I can buy 500 mL or 3 L glass jars at the moment.

responses.text: That's all for now.  Can we discuss something else?
That's all for now.  I'd best get going.

dynamic_line.gendered_line: I oversee the food stocks for the center.  There was significant looting during the panic when we first arrived so most of our food was carried away.  I manage what we have left and do everything I can to increase our supplies.  We've got a few growing sources of fresh meats and vegetables, so I prioritize non-perishable food, such as cornmeal, jerky, and fruit wine.

responses.text: Why cornmeal, jerky, and fruit wine?
Why cornmeal, jerky, and fruit wine?

dynamic_line: All three are easy to locally produce in significant quantities and are non-perishable.  We have a local farmer or two and a few hunter types that have been making attempts to provide us with the nutritious supplies.  We do always need more suppliers though.  This stuff is rather cheap in bulk, so I can pay a premium for any you have on you.  Canned food and other edibles are handled by the merchant in the front in trade.

responses.text: Are you looking to buy anything else?

dynamic_line: I'm actually accepting a number of different foodstuffs: beer, sugar, flour, smoked meat, smoked fish, dried fruit and vegetables, cooking oil, preservatives like salt and vinegar; and as mentioned before, jerky, cornmeal, and fruit wine.

We call them "Free Merchant Certified Notes".  We started signing money almost as soon as we got here as a way of showing it represented actual goods and services we had to trade.  Within a few days we'd organized the system, and now it's been evolving into a form of cash.  Internally they're traded for labor and services in exchange for food rations and other trade goods, but we've been using them with suppliers we regularly trade with as well, those that have faith in us.

dialogue.describe: I do have some work for you.
dialogue.offer: You heard right.  When you brought in those canning jars, it got us thinking about expanding our food storage from dehydrated to include cans.  We could use some larger jars though for big stock items.  Can you bring me 50 large three liter jars?  I'll pay you a Certified Note per two.
dialogue.accepted: Thank you.  Once we get a cottage industry set up with some of our inhabitants, I'll be able to start buying these from you and other scavengers in smaller lots.  This should be enough to test out our equipment.
dialogue.rejected: Oh well.  I'll see if I can find another supplier, thanks.
dialogue.advice: Grocery stores, house kitchens, there's plenty of places to look.
dialogue.success: Wow, that's a lot more jars than it sounded on paper.  Thanks.  Here's your payment.
dialogue.success_lie: What good does this do us?
dialogue.failure: I wonder where all the jars went...
